alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Douglas and northwestern Elbert Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 247 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kiowa, or 34 miles southeast of Denver, moving east at 10 mph. Another strong thunderstorm was developing about 8 miles west of Elbert. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. Torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree branches and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding of low lying areas possible. Locations impacted include... Elbert, Elizabeth, Kiowa and Ponderosa Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
